td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: Friday 21st[.] The men visited 2 nets which had been put in the water the day before yesterday[.] Took 6 Small pieces of Fish[.] The weather uncommon Cold for the Season[.] Got 6 more packs made but not pressed the weather will not allow us[.] Snowing & raining alternately[.]
Satury 22nd[.] The men made 11 packs[.] [W]eather as yesterday[.]

Suny 23rd[.] Arrived an Indian with two old women & 4 Children they came from lac du Sol – which they have been obliged to leave for want of subsistence[.] [T]hey can take no Fish & the Contagion which Carried off so many Animals large year has in all appearance lodged this year upon the Hares – Great numbers of which are found dead every where in the woods[.] The young man brought the Skin of a Bear that he found dead – yet this this Animal had at least 2 Inches & better of Depouille[.] I am assured by this visiter that he did not see one moose or Carribou Track Since he left the fore mentd Lake which is the 5th day he is marching[.] Fine weather[.]
My 24th[.] Ice driving very thick down the Grand River, Planted the Potatoes[.]

Thursy 27th[.] Since the 24th nothing occured worth mentioning except that the weather extremely rainy & the men worked at the Garden[.] Sowed our other Garden Seeds[.] Early in the morning – Martin with the two Hunters who I had sent with him arrived[.] They brought 17 Skins in Br & 19 in meat[.] One of them had near been drowned by falling thro' the Ice, by which accident he lost his Gun – and the Slave had burst the Gun (I had lent him) in firing at a Bear[.] [T]hese misfortunes have Kept them Idle above a month past – which is the reason they alledge for not making more provisions, for they tell me that the Animals above the old Fort are – dechen Laun-dai, Thlons i.e. there are so many, that they are as numerous as the Trees[.] Four other young men came from a band who are along the river, these paid 18 Skins of their debts – & Traded 31 more I mean in furrs – for they are Starving[.] Hares are indifferently beginning to be destroyed all over by the Contagion mentd before[.]
